review_title: Frustratingly comfortable clock in/out, but not rewarding
years_at_company: Frustratingly comfortable clock in/out, but not rewarding
pros: Full of people with good intentions and generally kind. Well capitalized from well matched investment group, and probably going to be around a few years given their position. Good healthcare. Comfortable work-life balance generally.
cons:
Organization isn't able to learn. See any business writeup for barriers to organizational learning for a description of Crestone. Long term incentive isn't. Org chart appears to be growing from top meaning no career growth. Leadership doesn't lead.

I suggest finding (ie. LinkedIn) someone who worked organizationally near to your role to make sure it's the kind of job you will stay at.
advice_to_mgmt: Recruiters have a lot of your employees resumes. As good opportunities appear, they're moving.

pros: CEO is a good man, passionate and motivated. Good pay and benefits carried over during transition.
cons: HR is nasty, spreads gossip and shares employee personal information. Most people donâ€™t want to be here. Huge disconnect and discontent between field and corporate. Failing the PR battle with the community. Depressing. A lot of good people planning to leave.
advice_to_mgmt: CEO please talk to your employees direct and find out what the problems are rather than relying on what your managers or HR are telling you.
